author: @GoncaloFaustino
text: Hey!  First of all, thanks for the tutorials, I really appreciate them. I'm a fan already! Everything's been working good so far but the 'command = quit (button disagree)' that, for some reason, isn't working for me. I don't know if you address this issue in the next videos but I just wanted to share a possible way to avoid this little problem, if anyone faced the same problem. It can be as simple as: def ShutProgram():         app.destroy() ...  button2=ttk.Button(self, text="Disagree", command=ShutProgram)  That worked just fine for me.

author: @morphman86
text: On the Wheel download site he showed, the numbers can be confusing, so let's see if I can clear it up in order for you to find the right file.  Package-PackageVersion-OperatingSystemVersion-[Possibly64BitVersion]-PythonVersion  So Pandas-0.15.1-win-amd64-py3.4 means it's Pandas version 0.15.1 for Windows 64 bit, running Python 3.4.  Hope that helped at least somebody find the right version!
